alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 29 at 1:08AM MST until October 30 at 11:00AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Elevated fire concerns expected through Monday as a windy, dry weather system moves through the region. Gusty north winds along the Colorado River Valley will range from 45 to 55 mph, with speeds above 60 mph possible, particularly near Laughlin and Bullhead City. Afternoon relative humidity values will range from 8 to 15 percent Sunday and Monday, with overnight recoveries between 20 and 30 percent. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT /11 AM MST/ THIS MORNING TO 11 AM PDT /11 AM MST/ MONDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR the Colorado River Valley... * AFFECTED AREA...In AZZ101...Fire Weather Zone 101. In California...Fire Weather Zone 229. In Nevada...Fire Weather Zone466. * TIMING...Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon. * WIND...North wind between 30 to 40 mph with gusts approaching 60 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity between 5 and 15 percent, with overnight recoveries between 20 and 30 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side
